main event: A round-shaped object, described as being 1-1/2' the size of a grapefruit, was observed near Brownsville, Tennessee, on April 14, 1958.
interesting points: The object was bright red in sunlight and gold in twilight,It was seen for a duration of 15 minutes,The observers used Navy binoculars for a better look,The conclusion from ATC was that the object was likely a balloon,The observation was categorized as a ground-visual type.
witness description: a farmer, a telephone operator, and a hardware salesman
